alert.note: Alert for Coastal Colleton; Inland Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 2:53PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF COLLETON COUNTY... At 253 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over White Hall, or 10 miles south of Walterboro, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Walterboro, Cottageville, Hendersonville, Green Pond, Jacksonboro, Ashepoo, Ritter and White Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
